data.title: [3.11] particles and SpriteFrames limitation
data.body:
Hi ,

I try to use a particle flower with an image from a texture pack so i use :

particleFlower->setDisplayFrame(SpriteFrameCache::getInstance()->getSpriteFrameByName("myPackedImage.png"));

Unfortunatly on android cocos2d displays the whole texture and not only the part of it corresponding to "myPackedImage.png". I think this behaviour can be seen because android does not assert.

The file CCParticuleSystemQuad.cpp contains the following assert:

```
CCASSERT(spriteFrame->getOffsetInPixels().isZero(), 
         "QuadParticle only supports SpriteFrames with no offsets");
```

My question is : are QuadParticules will support SpriteFrames with offsets in the future or will this limitation remain forerever in cocos2dx ?

Thanks you.

data.title: Make Downloader & AssetsManagerEx able to pause/resume
data.body:
When Internet connection is lost, the AssetsManagerEx current isn't aware of that, and will keep starting all the download tasks then failing all of them, dispatching a large amount of error events, triggering the event listener many times, which is not very ideal.

We implemented [Reachability](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/samplecode/Reachability/Introduction/Intro.html) on iOS/Android and wrapped them into a C++ class, which we would like to use it to determine the network status in the event listener, then pause/resume the AssetsManagerEx/Downloader depending on network status.

But the current AssetManagerEx/Downloader does not support pausing or resuming.

If you would accept PRs adding these features
- Pausing/Resuming Downloader
- Pausing/Resuming/Cancelling DownloadTask
- Pausing/Resuming AssetManager

We will be happy to make a PR adding these features.

But our team only work with C++ on iOS/Android, it would be kind of difficult for us to support and test against other platforms as well as the lua & js bindings.

I'm thinking about adding these feature only on iOS/Android with conditional compilation. And I would like to know what you guys think about it. Thanks. @minggo @pandamicro

[BUG]3.11 download zip file got crash.  repeat create/remove nodes got crash!
data.body:
I upgraded my app from 3.10 to 3.11, because I thought it  maybe fixed the crash bug when download zip files.

BUT,new bugs come and old bugs still stay in the latest version.
OLD BUG: 
When files loading(such as zip file), then touch screen quickly, app would get crash.

BTW, decompress zip file can block UI thread. If touch in the same time, app get crash either.

NEW BUG in 3.11: 
1.Create some nodes, add some image in them.

2,remove all of these nodes.

3,repeat about 100 times, depends on your devices. 

4, crash happen.

05-16 11:58:31.057: D/dalvikvm(6039): GC_CONCURRENT freed 406K, 10% free 6826K/7559K, paused 3ms+2ms

If load a node from cocos studio, the crash would appear more frequently.

data.title: Fix crash due to reallocation of shared indices memory
data.body:
This PR provides a fix for issue #15439.

As detailed in the issue, the crash is caused by multiple references to the static `__indices[]` array and the invalidation of these references when this cache is expanded with `realloc()`.

Rather than simply expanding, new memory is allocated to `__indicies[]` and references to any previous `__indicies` are captured by the `QuadCommand` for the duration of its lifetime. The triangle indices used by the `Renderer` are now guaranteed to be valid at the point copying the GL buffer.

The proposed fix will result in a slightly higher amount of memory usage whenever the shared indices buffer grows but will eventually stabilise (assuming no references to the `QuadCommand` are kept from deallocating).

Maybe a larger refactor for dealing with the shared memory should be considered but this is a fairly low impact fix which should at least stop the crashes!

data.title: Lazy initialization of shader programs in GLProgramCache
data.body:
(originally from http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/lazy-initialization-of-shader-programs-in-glprogramcache/29306/1)

Looking into GLProgramCache::loadDefaultGLPrograms() & GLProgramCache::reloadDefaultGLPrograms() (which is called when the renderer is recreated on Android), there are some shaders which are not necessary for certain use cases (not all apps use 3D / CCDrawNode / distance field etc.) and they are always initialized regardless. Compiling shaders and linking them are quite slow, is there any plan to move the shader initialization to the initialization of each related component?

data.title: Minimizing window on desktop causes drop of _designResolutionSize
data.body:
Version: cocos 3.11, OS: Windows 10.

onGLFWWindowSizeFunCallback was changed so that it's calling setFrameSize on window minimizing/maximizing. 
It causes drop of _designResolutionSize value (initial value not restored). Should I restore it manually now after minimize/maximize, or it's a bug?

(Looks like it finally fired : 
http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/potential-bug-in-cceglviewprotocol-setframesize/10796)

data.title: Suppress MSVC warning C4800
data.body:
Hello. This pull request suppresses the [C4800](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/b6801kcy.aspx) warnings in Visual Studio 2015, as shown below:

```
3>..\editor-support\cocostudio\WidgetReader\Light3DReader\Light3DReader.cpp(164): warning C4800: 'uint8_t' : forcing value to bool 'true' or 'false' (performance warning)
3>..\editor-support\cocostudio\WidgetReader\TabControlReader\TabControlReader.cpp(183): warning C4800: 'uint8_t' : forcing value to bool 'true' or 'false' (performance warning) 
3>..\network\WebSocket.cpp(814): warning C4800: 'int' : forcing value to bool 'true' or 'false' (performance warning)
3>..\platform\CCImage.cpp(2129): warning C4800: 'int' : forcing value to bool 'true' or 'false' (performance warning)
```

And thank you for releasing v3.11. :smiley:

data.title: Can't deliver the string contains chinese to javascript.
Cocos2d-x 3.11: PageView::setCurrentPageIndex does not trigger event "PageView::EventType::TURNING"
data.body:
I don't know if this is a bug or a design choice, but when it is called setCurrentPageIndex() on a PageView object the event PageView::EventType::TURNING does not trigger!
PageView::scrollToPage() does trigger the event PageView::EventType::TURNING correctly, but only when scroll ends.
Sometimes can be useful to jump immediately to a page triggering the turning event!

data.title: Cocos2d-x 3.11: PhysicsBody damping does not work [WITH SOLUTION]
data.body:
In cocos2d-x 3.11 the damping does not work.
I figure out the lines 776:781 in file CCPhysicsBody.cpp were left commented!
Un-commenting these lines damping seems to work fine!

data.title: Supporting IPv6-only Networks
data.body:
As [apple required to support IPv6-only Networks](https://developer.apple.com/news/?id=05042016a) since June 1, 2016. So we need to make sure cocos2d-x can work on IPv6-only Networks.

I think we should check
- 3rd party libraries supports IPv6-only networks
  - [x]  CURL
  - [x]   websocket
  
  any other?
- cocos2d-x provided network modules support IPv6-only networks
  - [x] HttpClient
  - [x] AssetsManagerEx
  - [x] SocketIO
  - [x] WebSocket
  - [x] Console
  - [x] ScriptingCore
  
  any else?

Found module that use IPV4 specific API:
- [serverEntryPoint in ScriptingCore](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/scripting/js-bindings/manual/ScriptingCore.cpp#L1883)

data.title: [ci skip]update to v3.11
otiose unscheduleUpdate() in onExit() in ui::Widget
data.body: there is no scheduleUpdate() in onEnter(), so unscheduleUpdate() in onExit() should be deleted.
